headline.main: Britain Moves To Expand Arrest Powers

lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Tony Blair's government asked Parliament today for emergency powers to permit the detention without trial of foreigners suspected of terrorism. Home Secretary David Blunkett submitted an order to the House of Commons declaring Britain to be in a ''state of public emergency'' and therefore entitled under European law to opt out of restrictions on such detentions in the European Convention on Human Rights.
abstract: Prime Min Tony Blair's government asks Parliament for emergency powers to permit detention without trial of foreigners suspected of terrorism; Home Sec David Blunkett submits order to House of Commons declaring Britain to be in 'state of public emergency' and therefore entitled under European law to opt out of restrictions on such detentions in European Convention on Human Rights; among provisions would be crackdown on supporters in Britain who conspire with terrorists abroad or assist them, new requirements on airlines to supply information about passengers and freight, tighter security at airports and extension of laws against inciting racial hatred to include religious hatred (M)
